  t.left(135)

def branch(side, level):
  if level == 0:
    return
  t.forward(side)
  t.left(angles_between_branches/2)
  branch(side / 2, level - 1)
  t.right(angles_between_branches)
  branch(side / 2, level - 1)
  t.left(angles_between_branches/2)
  t.forward(- side)
t.left(90)

description: a series of three and a half steps that look like a staircase viewed from the side. Starting from the top left, there is a short horizontal line that moves to the right, followed by a vertical line going downwards, forming the first step. This is followed by two more full steps, each consisting of a horizontal line followed by a vertical line. After the third step, there is a final horizontal line that represents the half step, without a subsequent vertical line descending from it.

def draw_square_and_diagonals(sides, length):
  outer_turn = 360 / sides 
  for _ in range(sides):
    t.forward(length)
    t.right(outer_turn)
  t.right(45)
  t.forward(length * sqrt(2))
  t.right(135)
  t.forward(length)
  t.right(135)
  t.forward(length * sqrt(2))
  t.right(45)
  t.forward(-length)
